name: electricity production, hydro, reservoir, tropical region | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21459/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity at grid-connected reservoir hydropower plants on the Brazil-Northern in 2014.;;The data about production was obtained in Matrizes Elétricas Estaduais: Ano Referência 2015 and Capacidade Instalada de Geração Elétrica Brasil e Mundo (2014): Ano Referência 2014. MME (2015; 2016).;The data about emissions was obtained in Projeto BALCAR: Emissões de Gases de Efeito Estufa em Reservatórios de Centrais Hidrelétricas. BRASIL (2014).;The data about water was obtained in Relatório de Sustentabilidade 2014. Itaipu Binacional. ITAIPU (2014).;;ITAIPU (2014). Relatório de Sustentabilidade 2014. Itaipu Binacional.;BRASIL (2014). Projeto BALCAR: Emissões de Gases de Efeito Estufa em Reservatórios de Centrais Hidrelétricas. Agência Nacional de Energia Elétrica – ANEEL.;MME (2015). Capacidade Instalada de Geração Elétrica Brasil e Mundo (2014): Ano Referência 2014. Edição de 05 de março de 2015. Ministério De Minas E Energia – MME. Secretaria De Planejamento E Desenvolvimento Energético. Núcleo De Estudos Estratégicos De Energia.;MME (2016). Matrizes Elétricas Estaduais: Ano Referência 2015. Edição de 23 de novembro de 2016. Ministério De Minas E Energia – MME. Secretaria De Planejamento E Desenvolvimento Energético. Núcleo De Estudos Estratégicos De Energia.;The original ecoinvent dataset used as a basis was 'electricity production, hydro, reservoir, tropical region, BR, 1990 - 2015' and it has been copied in '12/2017';[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

This dataset starts from the power plant ready to produce electricity, i.e. the reservoir filled with water.
From (potential) energy in water, entering the power plant.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes 
 - the area/volume occupied for the barrage, power station, and the lake
 - an estimation of emissions of carbon dioxide and methane 
 - operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants, such as lubricating oil or mass of water passing through the turbines. 


This dataset doesn't include
 - land use for access roads to the reservoir
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets 
 - transformation of the electricity produced.
 - dinitrogen oxide emissions
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Some data was extrapolated proportionally to the generation of each region.

Updated data for regionalization of Brazil (2014-2017):
- Annual Production Volume (specific data)
- Transformation, from forest  (specific data)
- Transformation, to lake  (specific data)
- Volume occupied  (specific data)
- Water, turbine use (specific data)

flow.name: electricity, high voltage

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value adopted from the global dataset "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, tropical region, GLO". Hertwich 2013 provides an analysis of greenhouse gas emissions from hydropower plants. 55 data points are available for tropical reservoir plants, from which the average CO2 and CH4 emissions are calculated. 
Hertwich, E.G. 2013. Addressing Biogenic Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Hydropower in LCA. Environmental Sciency&Technology, 47, 9604-9611

flow.name: Methane, non-fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value.

Data of reservoir surface area based on GRanD database (Lehner et al., 2011; Scherer; Pfister, 2016). Assuming a lifetime of 150 years and total energy production based on the installed capacity of each plant (ANEEL, 2018) with the capacity factor of each power plant and the Brazilian average for 2014 (MME, 2015). Values per region estimated based on a weighted average of the surface area and total energy production per power plant. Allocation factors based on the supplementary material (S1 Table) from Scherer and Pfister (2016).

ANEEL (2018) BIG - Banco de informações de geração. Brazilian Electricity Regulatory Agency. Available in: <http://www.aneel.gov.br/informacoes-tecnicas/-/asset_publisher/CegkWaVJWF5E/content/big-banco-de-informacoes-de-geracao/655808?inheritRedirect=false>
Lehner B, Reidy Liermann C, Revenga C, Vorosmarty C, Fekete B, Crouzet P, et al. High-Resolution Mapping of the World's Reservoirs and Dams for Sustainable River-Flow Management. Front Ecol Environ. 2011; 9: 494-502
MME (2015) Capacidade Instalada de Geração Elétrica Brasil e Mundo (2014). March, 2015.
Scherer L, Pfister S (2016) Hydropower's Biogenic Carbon Footprint. PLoS ONE 11(9):e0161947. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0161947. Available in: <http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0161947> Access in 04-2018.
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

exchanges.description:
There, a consumption of lubricating oil for turbines of 9 liters per GWh is estimated. With an oil density of 0.84 kg/l this amounts to 0.007 g/kWh. The lubricating oil is in a closed loop system (i.e. cannot get into the turbined water system) and is disposed annualy as waste oil in a hazardous waste treatment plant.
Estimation. Data for a run-of-river power station were overtaken.

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value. The needed amount of infrastructure per kWh produced is calculated with the lifetime and the annual net energy production (16500GWh/a).

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value taken over from global dataset "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, tropical region, GLO". Hertwich 2013 provides an analysis of greenhouse gas emissions from hydropower plants. 55 data points are available for tropical reservoir plants, from which the average CO2 and CH4 emissions are calculated. 
Hertwich, E.G. 2013. Addressing Biogenic Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Hydropower in LCA. Environmental Sciency&Technology, 47, 9604-9611

exchanges.description: Reflects range average to best performance.

Literature value/calculated value.

Only one plant in the Brazil have water use estimate (Itaipu-PR), this plant is responsible for 50% of the electricity generation in the southern region. So the data about water was obtained in Relatório de Sustentabilidade 2014. Itaipu Binacional. ITAIPU (2014).

This value was extrapolated to other regions.

ITAIPU (2014). Relatório de Sustentabilidade 2014. Itaipu Binacional.

flow.name: Water, turbine use, unspecified natural origin

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value.

Data of maximum storage capacity of reservoir based on GRanD database (Lehner et al., 2011; Scherer; Pfister, 2016). Assuming a lifetime of 150 years and total energy production based on the installed capacity of each plant (ANEEL, 2018) with the capacity factor of each power plant and the Brazilian average for 2014 (MME, 2015). Values per region estimated based on a weighted average of the reservoir capacity and total energy production per power plant. Allocation factors based on the supplementary material (S1 Table) from Scherer and Pfister (2016).

ANEEL (2018) BIG - Banco de informações de geração. Brazilian Electricity Regulatory Agency. Available in: <http://www.aneel.gov.br/informacoes-tecnicas/-/asset_publisher/CegkWaVJWF5E/content/big-banco-de-informacoes-de-geracao/655808?inheritRedirect=false>
Lehner B, Reidy Liermann C, Revenga C, Vorosmarty C, Fekete B, Crouzet P, et al. High-Resolution Mapping of the World's Reservoirs and Dams for Sustainable River-Flow Management. Front Ecol Environ. 2011; 9: 494-502
MME (2015) Capacidade Instalada de Geração Elétrica Brasil e Mundo (2014). March, 2015.
Scherer L, Pfister S (2016) Hydropower's Biogenic Carbon Footprint. PLoS ONE 11(9):e0161947. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0161947. Available in: <http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0161947> Access in 04-2018.

Literature value/calculated value.

The data for the region were obtained from Scherer L, Pfister S (2016) supporting information (S1 Table), and then the value was calculated by weighted averaging the area relative to the generations of each plant.

Scherer L, Pfister S (2016) Hydropower's Biogenic Carbon Footprint. PLoS ONE 11(9):e0161947. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0161947. Available in: <http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0161947> Access in 04-2018.
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation. Area for barrage and power station.

Estimative based on Frischknecht et al. (1996) assuming that 1% of the area covered by the reservoirs is added and assigned to the area covered by buildings and other infrastructures,

Frischknecht R, Bollens U, Bosshart S, Ciot M, Ciseri L, Doka G, Dones R, Gantner U, Hischier R, Martin A (1996) Ökoinventare von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. 3. Gruppe Energie - Stoffe - Umwelt (ESU), Eidgenössische Technische Hochschule Zürich und Sektion Ganzheitliche Systemanalysen, Paul Scherrer Institut, Villigen, Bundesamt für Energie (Hrsg.), Bern, CH, retrieved from: www.energieforschung.ch
